pullRequest.body:
* Follows on from #20272
* Rename some substructure constructions to align with `oneLE` / `nonneg`
* Clarify some documentation

Moves:
* squareIn -> square
* evenIn -> even
* sumSqIn -> sumSq

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [02c70f3aea](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20449/commits/02c70f3aeaabcc03477b780ebb6afe700818c71b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ mem_sumSq_of_isSquare`
`+ square_toSubmonoid`
`+ square_toSubsemigroup`
`+ sumSq`
`+++ coe_square`
`+++ mem_square`
`+++ square`
`- squareIn_toSubmonoid`
`- squareIn_toSubsemigroup`
`--- coe_squareIn`
`--- mem_squareIn`
`--- squareIn`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Part reverted, split to #20451, diffs should be cleaner now.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
I'm confused that the latest commit has a :negative_squared_cross_mark: even though the overall CI seems to be :heavy_check_mark: .

:v: artie2000 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> I'm confused that the latest commit has a ‚ùé even though the overall CI seems to be ‚úîÔ∏è .

It's written "[artie2000](https://github.com/artie2000) added a commit that referenced this pull request", not "[artie2000](https://github.com/artie2000) added a commit". The commit in question does not belong to this branch
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12636808428/job/35209715528)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12636808428/job/35209715814)
bors d+

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
bors d+

```suggestion
In a commutative monoid `M`, `Submonoid.square M` is the submonoid of squares in `M`.
```
right?
Could you please make the `initialize_simps_projections` + `to_additive` changes a separate PR?
You've lost the `norm_cast` attribute here

is `norm_cast` important?
it's not used in the other places using `simps`
maybe we could make `simps` add `norm_cast`?
Yeah, it would be great if `simps` added `norm_cast` automatically. It's not greatly important, but the lack of `norm_cast` tagging has bitten me in the past
OK, will avoid adding new simps in #20451 (I'll still fix the Subsemigroup thing)
This feels like a regression
I thought it would be silly to have that there for the sake of 1 lemma
I don't see the deprecations for these changes?
They were just added yesterday or today
Yeah, this PR follows a comment @YaelDillies made about the naming in #20272, after that PR was already on the maintainer queue

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra): make more names consistent

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Group/Even): "Advanced" lemmas about even elements.
